alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 11:39AM EDT until July 29 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bell County in southeastern Kentucky... Southern Harlan County in southeastern Kentucky... Central Knox County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 1139 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barbourville, Harlan, Pineville, Middlesboro, Loyall, Evarts, Wallins Creek, Black Snake, Balkan, Blackmont, Callaway, Pathfork, Molus, Oaks, Cubage, Miracle, Stony Fork Junction, Varilla, Coldiron and Kettle Island. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
